strengths: Several results discuss identifying spectroscopic binaries in various surveys, which is related to the spectroscopic analysis of stellar spectra.
A few results directly address determining stellar parameters and/or chemical abundances from LAMOST medium-resolution spectra, which is highly relevant to the main paper's topic.
One result discusses using the iSpec code for determining abundances of the Gaia FGK Benchmark Stars, which is closely aligned with the main paper's methodology.
weaknesses: Only one result directly mentions the iSpec code, which is the main focus of the paper.
Several results are only tangentially related to the main paper's topic, discussing spectroscopic analysis of other surveys or specific types of stars.
Some results focus on identifying spectroscopic binaries, which is related but not the main focus of the paper.
suggestions: Include more results that directly discuss the iSpec code and its application for determining stellar parameters and abundances.
Include results that compare the performance of iSpec with other spectroscopic analysis codes or methods.
Include results that discuss the limitations or potential improvements of iSpec or the methodology used in the main paper.
